Clip.Title: NATURE'S DIVE BOMBERS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Along the South African Coast, the Cape Gannet colonies feast on the East Coast, while those on the West Coast starve and struggle to survive due to commercial fishing.

Clip.Title: CHEETAH: PRICE OF SPEED
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The cheetah excels at acceleration and can run down high-speed prey faster than any mammal on Earth, but its quickness comes at a cost. Hunting means leaving cubs unattended and vulnerable to other predators of the Serengeti. The race for survival is on.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet must perform surgery to save a dog with a groundbreaking operation to replace his foot with a prosthetic and a second dog with a dislocation.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: At the eastern tip of Papua New Guinea lies a marine paradise made up of 600 remote islands. These distant islands far offshore are surrounded by countless pristine coral reefs. Just beneath the sea - life abounds. With over 1,500 species of fish… every single nook and cranny on the reefs are inhabited and exploited.

Clip.Title: NATURE'S DIVE BOMBERS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Along the South African Coast, the Cape Gannet colonies feast on the East Coast, while those on the West Coast starve and struggle to survive due to commercial fishing.

Clip.Title: CHEETAH: PRICE OF SPEED

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Small pockets of people begin to eke out an environmentally-sustainable way of life in America.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the highlands of the Americas to the world-famous tidal flats of the Bay of Fundy, this exploration of Nova Scotia reveals some of the world's best-kept secrets - here, on the edge of Canada.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From St. John's heading north, the Newfoundland coastline is a maze of iconic bays and inlets - from world-famous Fogo Island, to the abandoned fishing settlements along the island's Northern peninsula.

Just beneath the sea - life abounds. With over 1,500 species of fish… every single nook and cranny on the reefs are inhabited and exploited.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Recent technical failures aboard commercial aircrafts are detailed through harrowing footage aboard the troubled flights and survivors' firsthand accounts.

Clip.Title: 9/11: THE HEARTLAND TAPES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Across America, the morning of September 11, 2001 began routinely, with news and radio broadcasts sharing local human interest stories and traffic reports. But by 9:00 AM, the day's narrative had taken a tragic turn. Most of us are familiar with the national news coverage of 9/11, but the local reporting from TV and radio affiliates across the nation was no less important and no less compelling. This is an account of the tragedy as it unfolded, and as it aired in American cities large and small, told without narration or interviews.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the remote Northern Shore of Nova Scotia, to the red mud perimetre of Prince Edward Island, the warm waters of the Northumberland Strait are the setting for an incredible aerial exploration of these coastlines.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey over New Brunswick's Bay of Fundy coastline explores geological wonders, the loyalist city of Saint John and international borders beyond and one of the world's most famous waterways.

Clip.Title: CANNIBAL ISLAND
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Amidst the purges of the Stalin-era, dissidents sent to a remote prison camp resort to desperate measures to survive.

Clip.Title: COLDITZ THE LEGEND
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Colditz- a Caste near Leipzig in Germany- was the most feared POW Facility of WW2. This exciting and moving new documentary takes a fresh look at the legend, hearing from both Colditz survivors and their families.

Clip.Title: A STORY OF PEOPLE IN WAR AND PEACE
Clip.Episode: A Story Of People in War and Peace
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Live alongside Armenian soldiers caught in the Karabakh war (89-94) and reunite with them in present day as they search to find answers to the war and lessons for peace.

Clip.Title: CANNIBAL ISLAND
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Amidst the purges of the Stalin-era, dissidents sent to a remote prison camp resort to desperate measures to survive.
